column4: did you install it through package management? (the java package from the repositories?)
use the wiki, not ubuntuguide.  And, java has a package, it does it all for you.
you'll get whatever feature enhancements are in v10, but you'll lose all the benefits of package management.  Just like all software
as an alternative, would a FAT32 partition allow me to transfer files between ntfs and ext3
actually, I stand corrected.  Looks like they released a "stable" version today.
no idea what their definition of "stable" is though
I saw the word stable on their site but wondered what that meaned exactly
Only they'd know.  Well, they might have info on the site
the amount of packages on them
but installation should be relatively the same?
yeah, as far as I know.
/var/cache/apt/archives has the debs.  but, "dpkg -l" will print all your currently installed packages

i was thinking of copying the debs into by /home folder and then once i reinstall feisty using them to quickly reinstall all the programs again ... rather than downloading them all again ... does this make sense and will it work?
